update.description:
This PR adds a unit test for JointState, validating that serialization and deserialization works.

Adding this test revealed two bugs (both of which have been fixed):

* A JointState associated with no axes resulted in malformed SDF output.  (A <joint> element under <state> must have at least one <angle> child element. [http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=state#joint_angle](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=state#joint_angle))
* The 'axis' attribute of the <angle> element was not incremented for each axis, so multi-axis joint states would contain multiple <angle axis='0'> elements.
update.title: Add testing for JointState serialization/deserialization

content.raw: This PR is good to go.

Would you be able to sign a Corporate CLA? We have a form similar to the [apache cla](http://www.apache.org/licenses/cla-corporate.txt).

If so, could you contact me at nate@osrfoundation.org.
content.html:
Would you be able to sign a Corporate CLA? We have a form similar to the apache cla.

If so, could you contact me at nate@osrfoundation.org.

content.raw: Is this policy explicitly documented somewhere other than that PR?  Unfortunately, this means we likely won't be able to contribute to Gazebo.
content.html: Is this policy explicitly documented somewhere other than that PR? Unfortunately, this means we likely won't be able to contribute to Gazebo.

content.raw:
I believe we're requiring transfer of copyright, see this:

#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2366/an-intel-real-sense-r200-camera-plugin/diff#comment-20467920
content.html:
I believe we're requiring transfer of copyright, see this:

#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2366/an-intel-real-sense-r200-camera-plugin/diff#comment-20467920

content.raw:
The copyright on this patch is owned by Google.  I can add Google to the AUTHORS file at the root of the repo and change the copyright statement to
```Copyright (C) 2017 The Gazebo Project Authors```.  Does that work?
content.html: The copyright on this patch is owned by Google. I can add Google to the AUTHORS file at the root of the repo and change the copyright statement to Copyright (C) 2017 The Gazebo Project Authors. Does that work?

This PR adds a unit test for JointState, validating that serialization and deserialization works.

Adding this test revealed two bugs (both of which have been fixed):

* A JointState associated with no axes resulted in malformed SDF output.  (A <joint> element under <state> must have at least one <angle> child element. [http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=state#joint_angle](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=state#joint_angle))
* The 'axis' attribute of the <angle> element was not incremented for each axis, so multi-axis joint states would contain multiple <angle axis='0'> elements.

content.raw: @_jrivero_  , the homebrew job failed to clone the fork, do you have an idea of what's happening? Thanks!
content.html: @jrivero , the homebrew job failed to clone the fork, do you have an idea of what's happening? Thanks!

content.raw: The tests are very complete, thanks for taking the time. I only have a couple of comments related to style, and will wait for the results from Jenkins.
content.html: The tests are very complete, thanks for taking the time. I only have a couple of comments related to style, and will wait for the results from Jenkins.

content.raw: We're moving towards using `nullptr` instead of `NULL`. It would be great if you could change this, otherwise we can change it after it's merged.
content.html: We're moving towards using nullptr instead of NULL. It would be great if you could change this, otherwise we can change it after it's merged.

content.raw: In order to merge the code into this repository, it needs to say `Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation`, would you be ok with that?
content.html: In order to merge the code into this repository, it needs to say Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation, would you be ok with that?

content.raw: Just a detail from our [style guide](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=contrib_code&cat=development#Style), the `{` has to be on a new line by itself.
content.html: Just a detail from our style guide, the { has to be on a new line by itself.

content.raw:
Thank you for the contribution! I've started two CI jobs:

* [homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1012/)
* [Xenial Nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/108/)
content.html:
Thank you for the contribution! I've started two CI jobs:

  • Xenial Nvidia
